description: Splits I/O JSON Schema is a specification for the transmission of runs between services and programs.
title: Splits I/O JSON Schema

_88runTime.description: Run Time represents a moment inside a run, and indicates the duration of the run so far at that moment. It holds a realtime run duration so far and a gametime run duration so far.
_88runTime.title: Run Time

___gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration a run so far in milliseconds.
___gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

___realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of a run so far in milliseconds.
___realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

_88duration.description: Duration holds a realtime duration and a gametime duration.
_88duration.title: Duration

___gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in game-world time.
___gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

___realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in real-world time.
___realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

___runners.description: Runners is an array of people who participated in this run. Some games and categories call for cooperative play, but otherwise this will usually be just one person.
___runners.title: Runners

items.description: Runner describes one participant in the recorded run.
items.title: Runner

___links.description: Links specifies the runner's identity in other services.
___links.title: Links

___speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID specifies the runner's Speedrun.com ID.
___speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

___twitterID.description: Twitter ID specifies the runner's Twitter ID.
___twitterID.title: Twitter ID

___splitsioID.description: Splits I/O ID specifies the runner's Splits I/O ID.
___splitsioID.title: Splits I/O ID

___twitchID.description: Twitch ID specifies the runner's Twitch ID.
___twitchID.title: Twitch ID

___longname.description: Longname is a human-readable runner name, intended for display to users.
___longname.title: Longname

___shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable runner name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
___shortname.title: Shortname

___links.description: Links specifies the run's identity in other services.
___links.title: Links

___speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID is the run's ID on Speedrun.com. This can be used to communicate with the Speedrun.com API.
___speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

___splitsioID.description: Splits I/O ID is the run's ID on Splits I/O. This can be used to communicate with the Splits I/O API.
___splitsioID.title: Splits I/O ID

___game.description: Game specifies information about the game being run.
___game.title: Game

___links.description: Links specifies the game's identity in other services.
___links.title: Links

___speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID specifies the game's Speedrun.com ID.
___speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

___splitsioID.description: Splits I/O ID specifies the game's Splits I/O ID.
___splitsioID.title: Splits I/O ID

examples: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
___longname.description: Longname is a human-readable game name, intended for display to users.
___longname.title: Longname

___shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable game name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
___shortname.title: Shortname

___segments.description: Segments is an array of all segments for this run, ordered from first to last.
___segments.title: Segments

items.description: Segment is one segment in this run.
items.title: Segment

___name.description: Name is the runner-provided name of this segment
___name.title: Name

___isReset.description: Is Reset should be true if the runner reset the run during this segment. If so, this and all future segments' Ended Ats for this run are ignored.
___isReset.title: Is Reset

$eref.description: Duration holds a realtime duration and a gametime duration.
$eref.title: Duration

___gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in game-world time.
___gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

___realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in real-world time.
___realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

___histories.description: Histories is an array of previous completions of this segment by this runner.
___histories.title: Histories

items.description: History is a single recorded attempt of this segment by this runner.
items.title: History

___isReset.description: Is Reset should be true if the runner reset the run during this segment. If so, this and all future segments' Ended Ats for this run are ignored.
___isReset.title: Is Reset

___attemptNumber.description: Attempt Number is the number of lifetime attempts the runner will have made on this category after this one. Generally these attempt numbers should correspond to those in Attempts -> History, although a number given here may not be present there if the run was reset before completion.
___attemptNumber.title: Attempt Number

___isSkipped.description: Is Skipped should be true if the runner skipped over the split that ends this segment, rather than splitting. If so, this segment's Ended At is ignored.
___isSkipped.title: Is Skipped

$eref.description: Run Time represents a moment inside a run, and indicates the duration of the run so far at that moment. It holds a realtime run duration so far and a gametime run duration so far.
$eref.title: Run Time

___gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration a run so far in milliseconds.
___gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

___realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of a run so far in milliseconds.
___realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

___isSkipped.description: Is Skipped should be true if the runner skipped over the split that ends this segment, rather than splitting. If so, this segment's Ended At is ignored.
___isSkipped.title: Is Skipped

$eref.description: Run Time represents a moment inside a run, and indicates the duration of the run so far at that moment. It holds a realtime run duration so far and a gametime run duration so far.
$eref.title: Run Time

___gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration a run so far in milliseconds.
___gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

___realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of a run so far in milliseconds.
___realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

___pauses.description: Pauses holds runner-caused pauses that took place during the run.
___pauses.title: Pauses

items.description: Pause is a single pause that took place during the run.
items.title: Pause

___startedAt.description: Started At is the date and time at which the pause was started, specified in RFC 3339 format.
___startedAt.title: Started At

___endedAt.description: Ended At is the date and time at which the pause was ended, specified in RFC 3339 format.
___endedAt.title: Ended At

____schemaVersion.description: Schema Version specifies which version of the Splits I/O JSON Schema is being used. This schema specifies only v1.0.0.
____schemaVersion.title: Splits I/O JSON Schema Version

___imageURL.description: Image URL is the location of an image associated with this run. Often this is a screenshot of the timer at run completion, but can be anything the runner wants displayed alongside the run.
___imageURL.title: Image URL

___videoURL.description: Video URL is the location of a VOD of the run.
___videoURL.title: Video URL

___timer.description: Timer holds information about the timer used to record the run.
___timer.title: Timer

___version.description: Version is the version of the timer used to record this run. Semantic Versioning is strongly recommended but not enforced.
___version.title: Version

___website.description: Website is the URL for the timer's website.
___website.title: Website

___longname.description: Longname is a human-readable timer name, intended for display to users.
___longname.title: Longname

___shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable timer name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
___shortname.title: Shortname

___category.description: Category specifies information about the category being run.
___category.title: Category

___links.description: Links specifies the category's identity in other services.
___links.title: Links

___speedruncomID.description: Speedrun.com ID specifies the category's Speedrun.com ID.
___speedruncomID.title: Speedrun.com ID

___splitsioID.description: Splits I/O ID specifies the category's Splits I/O ID.
___splitsioID.title: Splits I/O ID

___longname.description: Longname is a human-readable category name, intended for display to users.
___longname.title: Longname

___shortname.description: Shortname is a machine-readable category name, intended for use in APIs, databases, URLs, and filenames.
___shortname.title: Shortname

___attempts.description: Attempts contains historical information about previous runs by this runner in this category.
___attempts.title: Attempts

___total.description: Total holds the total number of attempts for this category.
___total.title: Total

___histories.description: Histories is an array of previous attempts by this runner of this category.
___histories.title: Histories

items.description: History is a single recorded attempt of this category by this runner.
items.title: History

___attemptNumber.description: Attempt Number is the number of lifetime attempts the runner will have made after this one. The Attempt Number for an attempt is a label, not an index; the first attempt for a category has an Attempt Number of 1 (not 0).
___attemptNumber.title: Attempt Number

$eref.description: Duration holds a realtime duration and a gametime duration.
$eref.title: Duration

___gametimeMS.description: Gametime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in game-world time.
___gametimeMS.title: Gametime (Milliseconds)

___realtimeMS.description: Realtime (Milliseconds) is a duration of milliseconds in real-world time.
___realtimeMS.title: Realtime (Milliseconds)

___startedAt.description: Started At is the date and time at which the run was started, specified in RFC 3339 format.
___startedAt.title: Started At

___endedAt.description: Ended At is the date and time at which the run was ended, specified in RFC 3339 format.
___endedAt.title: Ended At
